originalText.text: My appointment was at 1:30 I was laid by 10 minutes I was laid by 10 minutes and when I walked into a door I was asked to reschedule for another day. Awful customer service.

text.text: My appointment was at 1:30 I was laid by 10 minutes I was laid by 10 minutes and when I walked into a door I was asked to reschedule for another day. Awful customer service.

originalText.text: I have 4 credit cards and multiple bank accounts with Chase. They have zero respect or desire to help customers at this location. To get a single document Notarized you have to make an appointment at least a week out. I was able to go to Bank of America where I dont even have an account and they did it for free the same day.

text.text: I have 4 credit cards and multiple bank accounts with Chase. They have zero respect or desire to help customers at this location. To get a single document Notarized you have to make an appointment at least a week out. I was able to go to Bank of America where I dont even have an account and they did it for free the same day.

originalText.text: It's pretty hard to leave a one star rating for a commercial bank which all you do with them is simple banking but somehow this branch of Chase was able to pull it off. I walked in for a simple banking request which customer service had directed to go to the bank for. I stayed in line to see one of the bankers, when a chase employee asked me what I needed. I explained it and she told me to stay in a different line to get to one of the cashiers. I stood in line for a while and when I got there the cashier told me I should see a banker and now it's too late to see one and I should come back on a different day. I explained I was in the right line and your colleague (I pointed to her) asked to stand here. All I got from the cashier was a polite "tough luck". As much as the cashier was nice, it didn't compensate for my wasted time and lack of ownership on fixing a mistake that they had done. Mistakes happen, not fixing them because we are close to the end of the day and we can't own up to our mistakes.

originalText.text: I've been with Chase for 40 years.  Branch was moved to this location.   Not as convenient, a good 20 minute walk.  I called ahead and asked if I could come in to get something notarized.  Was told just come in, no need to make an appointment.  I emphasized that I didn't want to come all the way there if I couldn't get the notary service.  The gentleman told me that Dante was in.  He looked it up.  I actually said:  "Are you sure?"  YES I was told.  Unfortunately, I didn't get the name of the gentleman I spoke to.  My husband and I walked there.  My husband is not well, but he had to be there to get the document we needed notarized with his signature.  Guess what?  No Dante.  "He's not in today"  and our list is full for notarizing.  I explained that I took pains to confirm before coming all the way down there.  "Let me speak to the manager".  Manager comes out.  "Abrupt.  Can't help you.  Sorry."  I explained I phoned ahead.  "Who did you speak to?"  I said, I don't remember his name and I had no reason to write it down because I didn't doubt his word" The manager implied I was making it up because I didn't know who I spoke to.  I said, "How would I know that the notary's name is Dante unless I spoke to an associate of yours?"  Can't you squeeze me in since I was given the wrong information and actually phoned ahead?  "Who did you speak to?" the manager says again and again.  As if the fact that I didn't get a name was a good enough reason to turn me away.  He had "Not going to help" written all over his face.  Go to UPS.  It was the principal of the matter.  I'm a Private Client customer, a long time customer and I believe that they could've squeezed me in if he'd wanted to help. I will never use my own branch again unless I have to get into my safety deposit box.

originalText.text: Rosa Perez - ZERO empathy for customers or employees that are petty new and takes 56 minutes for a transaction that easily takes 10 min in another branch. First and last time I use this location. AVOID IT!
